topic.title: Set up Mingle with Slack
topic.p: In order to use the integration, it will need to be configured in three steps.

p.strong: 1. Integrate your Mingle instance with your Slack team

topic.p: A Mingle administrator will have to configure this from the home page.

bullets.item: From the Mingle home page, click on Admin > Integrations
You will be redirected to a Slack page. Log in with your Slack account, and select the team you’d like to integrate with
You will be redirected back to the Mingle home page

p.strong: 2. Integrate your project with a Slack channel

topic.p: Once a Mingle administrator has tied a Slack team to the instance, a project administrator can set up the integration for their project.

bullets.item: From within the project, click on the Project Admin, and select Slack under the Integrations section
All open channels from your Slack team are listed here. Select the one you’d like to integrate with, and proceed
To integrate with a private channel, complete Step 3 first (link your Mingle profile with your Slack account) and then click on Get private channels
A confirmation message is posted on the channel on Slack. This channel will receive all murmurs addressed to @team. All slash commands are executable from this channel.
You could integrate more channels to your project. Select from the dropdown, and save. You will now be able run slash commands from any of these channels.

p.strong: 3. Integrate individual Mingle profiles with Slack accounts

topic.p: In order for us to know who you are on Slack, you will have to tie your Mingle profile to your Slack id.

bullets.item: Each team member will have to navigate to their profile page from the profile icon on the top right corner
bullets.p: You will now be able to use all the features that the Slack integration offers.
